title: Prajwal Revanna gets life imprisonment for raping 47-year-old domestic worker
content: A special court in Bengaluru sentenced ex-MP Prajwal Revanna to life imprisonment on Saturday, following his conviction for the rape of a 47-year-old domestic worker. Revanna was found guilty of multiple offenses, including sexual harassment and voyeurism. He had fled to Germany after explicit videos surfaced but was arrested upon his return to India in May.

title: Tejashwi targets EC with 'EPIC' barb over 'missing name'; poll panel, BJP hit back
content: Tejashwi Yadav ignited a political controversy by alleging his name was missing from Bihar's voter list, accusing the Election Commission of a conspiracy to manipulate voter rolls. He questioned the deletion of 65 lakh names and demanded transparency from the EC.

title: 'Was tortured to name PM Modi': Pragya Thakur's big claim in Malegaon blast case
content: Sadhvi Pragya states coercion in naming leaders. A special NIA court acquitted all seven accused in the 2008 Malegaon blast case. The blast resulted in six deaths and numerous injuries. The court cited lack of evidence against Pragya Thakur. Investigations initially pointed to "saffron extremists". The case saw twists, including allegations against the NIA.

title: Mark Zuckerberg meets 24-yr-old AI researcher who rejected Meta's $125m job offer
content: Meta's aggressive pursuit of AI dominance led them to recruit 24-year-old Matt Deitke, initially offering $125 million, which he declined. Zuckerberg's personal intervention resulted in a revised $250 million package, including potential $100 million in the first year. Deitke, known for his work on Molmo and founding Vercept, is a highly sought-after AI talent.

title: Watch | Gill, Gambhir's priceless reactions after Akash Deep's 50: 'Smile says it all'
content: Akash Deep's remarkable 66, achieved as nightwatchman, ignited celebrations in the Indian dressing room during the fifth Test. His partnership with Yashasvi Jaiswal surpassed a significant milestone, becoming the 18th century stand of the series. Gautam Gambhir and Shubman Gill's visible pride underscored the innings' impact, boosting India's lead and denting England's morale.

title: 'Detonate atom bomb': Rajnath mocks, dares Rahul to share EC 'vote theft' proof
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has strongly criticized Rahul Gandhi's claim of possessing evidence of election malpractice in Bihar. Addressing a gathering in Patna, Singh urged Gandhi to reveal his so-called 'atom bomb' of evidence immediately. He also defended the Election Commission's integrity and highlighted Nitish Kumar's role in Bihar's transformation, contrasting it with Congress's past actions like the 1975 Emergency.

title: Nightwatchman Akash Deep breaks records; outshines Gautam Gambhir with fifty in England
content: Akash Deep's remarkable 66 as nightwatchman alongside Yashasvi Jaiswal's anchoring innings has solidified India's position in the fifth Test at The Oval. Their century partnership, a series highlight, surpassed a record set in 2003-04.

title: LinkedIn cofounder, Silicon Valley's biggest democrat supporter says: There's a problem with Blue states and…
content: Reid Hoffman admits that the Democratic Party alienated Silicon Valley. This drove tech leaders towards Donald Trump. He says attacks on cryptocurrency and Big Tech companies caused this shift. Hoffman points to California's regulations as a problem. He notes companies like Aurora Innovation tested in Texas due to better rules. He urges Democrats to adopt business-friendly policies.

title: 'Desh ka raja kaisa ho, Rahul jaisa ho' slogans at Cong event. Here's how he reacted
content: At a Congress Legal Conclave in Delhi, Rahul Gandhi rejected chants of him being the 'king' and launched a strong attack on the Election Commission of India. Gandhi alleged the 2024 Lok Sabha elections were rigged, claiming the electoral system is 'dead'.

title: Spirit of cricket: Are India, England the worst-behaved teams in Test cricket?
content: The India vs England Test series has sparked debates over the spirit of cricket, with India accumulating more ICC demerit points. Sri Lanka statistically emerges as the worst-behaved team in the last two years, while England, Australia, and South Africa have the fewest demerit points. Despite recent tensions, England ranks among the best-behaved teams, and India sits in the middle.

title: Tim Cook sets new leadership milestone: outpaces Steve Jobs; what it reveals about Apple’s journey
content: Tim Cook has surpassed Steve Jobs as Apple's longest-serving CEO, marking a significant milestone. Cook's leadership has steered Apple towards financial stability, achieving record-breaking market capitalization and global expansion. While Jobs was known for disruptive innovation, Cook's tenure emphasizes sustainability, inclusivity, and long-term growth, transforming Apple into a diversified tech empire with a focus on services and hardware.

title: Watch: Rohit Sharma arrives at The Oval as India make strong start on Day 3
content: Rohit Sharma, former India captain, was seen at The Oval on Day 3 of the crucial fifth Test, boosting fans' spirits. India started the day strong, with Akash Deep's surprising resilience and Yashasvi Jaiswal's continued form, reaching another half-century.

title: 'Stay out of the way': Shastri, Atherton slam Akash Deep's send-off to Duckett
content: During the fifth Test at The Oval, Indian pacer Akash Deep's demonstrative send-off to Ben Duckett sparked controversy. After dismissing Duckett, Akash Deep put his arm around the batter, prompting disapproval from commentators Michael Atherton and Ravi Shastri. They cautioned against physical contact, citing potential escalation and the importance of respecting boundaries in a non-contact sport.

title: 'Saiyaara' box office: Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda’s film earns around Rs 3 cr on Saturday
content: Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda's 'Saiyaara,' directed by Mohit Suri, continues its box office reign, nearing Rs 300 crore after 16 days. The film earned Rs 2.84 crore on Saturday, totaling Rs 287.84 crore. Despite new releases like 'Son of Sardaar 2' and 'Dhadak 2,' 'Saiyaara' maintains a strong performance, outperforming 'Dhadak 2' in early earnings.

title: 'Gives bowlers no time to settle': Sidhu compares Jaiswal's impact to Sehwag
content: Navjot Singh Sidhu lauded Yashasvi Jaiswal, drawing parallels to Virender Sehwag's impactful opening style. Sidhu highlighted Jaiswal's aggressive yet composed approach after his quickfire fifty against England. He emphasised Jaiswal's ability to dominate bowlers and put his team in a winning position, praising his technical strengths and comparing his impact to Sehwag's after Sunil Gavaskar.

title: Uttarakhand: Landslide hits Vishnugad-Pipalkoti project site; 8 injured
content: A landslide at the Helang dam site of the Vishnugad-Pipalkoti hydropower project in Chamoli district injured eight workers on Saturday. Rescue teams swiftly responded, providing medical assistance and transporting the injured to various hospitals. While four are being treated at the THDC Hospital, others with more severe injuries have been referred to specialized medical facilities, with no fatalities reported.

title: 'I love to play for the country' says Siraj on playing all five Tests vs England - Watch
content: Driven by passion, Mohammed Siraj embraces responsibility in the ongoing England series, dismissing concerns about physical strain. He took 4/86, matching Prasidh Krishna's figures, as India bowled England out for 247. Siraj's key wickets included Root and Brook. India ended Day 2 at 75/2, leading by 52 runs, with Jaiswal unbeaten on 51.

title: 'Farm laws introduced in 2020': Arun Jaitley's son on Rahul Gandhi's accusations
content: Rahul Gandhi alleged that Arun Jaitley threatened him over farm laws, sparking a strong rebuttal from Jaitley's son, Rohan. Rohan Jaitley refuted Gandhi's claim, stating his father passed away before the laws were introduced and emphasized his democratic nature. He also urged Gandhi to be cautious when speaking about deceased figures, referencing a similar incident involving Manohar Parrikar.

title: Himachal flashfloods: Cofferdam bursts at power site; vehicles swept away in Kullu
content: Relentless monsoon rains in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district caused the collapse of a cofferdam at the Malana-I Hydropower Project, triggering flash floods and sweeping away heavy machinery. The incident has exacerbated the monsoon's devastating impact, leaving hundreds of roads blocked, power transformers failed, and water supply systems non-functional.

title: ‘Dhadak 2’ box office: Siddhant Chaturvedi & Tripti Dimri starrer earns Rs 5 cr on Saturday
content: This Friday witnessed a cinematic clash with 'Son Of Sardaar 2', a desi comedy starring Ajay Devgn and Mrunal Thakur, edging out the romantic drama 'Dhadak 2' featuring Siddhant Chaturvedi and Triptii Dimri. 'Son Of Sardaar 2' is nearing double-digit earnings, while 'Dhadak 2', a remake exploring societal evils, saw a slower Saturday, collecting ₹1.

title: 'Operation Akhal': 2 terrorists killed in J&K's Kulgam; joint operation under way
content: According to officials, a joint team of the Jammu and Kashmir Police, Army and CRPF launched a cordon and search operation in the Akhal forest area of south Kashmir’s Kulgam district on Friday. The action was based on specific intelligence inputs about the presence of terrorists in the area, a police official told news agency PTI.

title: Messi to visit Kolkata, Ahmedabad, Mumbai and Delhi - complete itinerary
content: Lionel Messi plans to visit India in December 2025. The Argentine captain will tour Kolkata, Ahmedabad, Mumbai, and New Delhi. He will unveil a 70-foot statue and participate in 'GOAT Cup' events. Messi will conduct masterclasses with children and meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The tour includes events at Eden Gardens and Wankhede Stadium.

title: Nagpur woman marries 8 men, blackmails them for lakhs
content: Sameera Fatima got arrested in Nagpur for allegedly marrying eight men and extorting money. She targeted married men, gained their trust, and then filed false harassment cases. She extorted lakhs of rupees from each victim. Ghulam Pathan, her last husband, filed a complaint leading to her arrest. Police caught her at Dolly Ki Tapri with Pathan's help.

title: 'Atmosphere of global instability': PM Modi's message amid US trade stand-off
content: Amid escalating trade tensions with the US, Prime Minister Modi asserted India's commitment to prioritizing its farmers, small industries, and youth welfare. He urged citizens to embrace indigenous goods, emphasizing economic self-reliance and paying tribute to Mahatma Gandhi. Modi also issued a strong warning to Pakistan following a terrorist attack, vowing retaliation and dedicating it to national pride.

title: Rape case: Revanna breaks down in court again; pleads for minimum punishment
content: Prajwal Revanna, the former Hassan MP and grandson of HD Deve Gowda, was convicted of rape and other offenses against a 47-year-old domestic worker in a Bengaluru special court. Revanna broke down in court on Saturday following the verdict, which included charges of sexual harassment, voyeurism, and destruction of evidence. The court is scheduled to announce the sentence later today.

title: Rahul says EC 'obliterated & taken over'; claims 15 seats were rigged in LS elections
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has launched a scathing attack on the Election Commission, alleging that India's election system is 'dead' and the recent Lok Sabha elections were rigged. Gandhi claims to possess irrefutable proof of electoral malpractice, including manipulated voter data, which he plans to reveal soon.

title: 'Bhagwa, Sanatana aur Rashtra ki vijay': Pragya hails Malegaon case verdict
content: Pragya Singh Thakur, former BJP MP, declared her acquittal in the 2008 Malegaon blast case as a victory for 'Bhagwa, Sanatana and Rashtra,' accusing Congress of fabricating the lawsuit. The NIA court acquitted all seven accused due to the prosecution's failure to establish the case beyond a reasonable doubt.

title: Gujarat teacher kills sons, self over wife’s affair; woman, her lover booked
content: Alpesh Solanki, a PE teacher in Surat, tragically ended his life and those of his two sons, driven to despair by his wife Falguni's alleged infidelity with Naresh Rathod. Police arrested Falguni and Rathod for abetment to suicide after Solanki detailed the affair and mental torment in a suicide note, diaries, and video recordings.

title: Watch: UP cop offers milk and flowers to floodwater entering his home
content: A Prayagraj police officer, Chandradeep Nishad, was captured on video worshipping floodwater outside his home, as monsoon rains intensify across northern India. Nishad, seen offering milk and flowers to the water he calls “Mother Ganga,” shared the video on Instagram.

title: Couple abandons 10-year-old son in Barcelona airport to catch flight on time
content: A couple reportedly left their ten-year-old son at Barcelona airport. The parents discovered his passport had expired. They boarded their flight home without him. A terminal worker shared a video criticizing their actions. Airport staff found the boy alone and alerted the police. The parents were located and taken off the plane for questioning.

title: India still buying oil from Russia: Report rebuts Trump's 'good steps' claim
content: Despite Trump's claim that India has ceased oil imports from Russia, government sources confirm that Indian refiners continue to purchase Russian crude, driven by economic factors like price and logistics.

title: 'I just don’t want people to get hurt': Trump on Epstein files
content: Donald Trump expressed his willingness to release all government information related to Jeffrey Epstein, emphasizing the need to protect innocent individuals. While open to considering pardons in general, he remained cautious about Ghislaine Maxwell's case, citing unfamiliarity. Trump seemed unlikely to pardon Sean "Diddy" Combs, referencing their past friendly relationship soured by Combs' critical statements during Trump's political campaigns.

title: IIT-Bombay student dies after fall from hostel terrace
content: A 26-year-old IIT Bombay student, Rohit Sinha, was discovered dead on the campus grounds, prompting an investigation by the Powai police. Sinha, a fourth-year student in the Meta Science program, was found under circumstances that led to the registration of an accidental death report.

title: Hyderabad accountant wakes up naked next to stranger, framed for murder
content: A 46-year-old accountant's pursuit of a younger woman spiraled into a nightmare when he was drugged, photographed naked, and blackmailed by a gang posing as police. The fraudsters demanded Rs 10 lakh, even attempting to extort his wife, who refused to pay.

title: 'Her lips move like ... ': Trump praises Karoline Leavitt - Watch video
content: Donald Trump praised Karoline Leavitt, hinting at potential pardons for Ghislaine Maxwell and Sean Combs, while advocating severe consequences for Obama and Clinton over the 2016 election interference. He addressed Medvedev's nuclear remarks, confirmed US nuclear subs' proximity to Russia, and expressed reluctance to remove Jerome Powell as Fed chair despite criticism.

title: Trade talks: Govt hardens stand on no-go areas
content: Amidst new US levies on Indian exports, the government твердо stands firm on protecting its farmers' interests, especially regarding farm, dairy, and genetically modified products. While acknowledging a potential 0.2% GDP impact, officials emphasize that cultural sensitivities and farmer welfare are paramount in upcoming talks with the US, scheduled to begin August 25.

title: 126 packages, six countries: Israel airdrops aid in Gaza
content: The IDF, in collaboration with six nations including Spain, France, and Germany, air-dropped humanitarian aid into Gaza, delivering 126 food packages. This initiative occurs amidst rising global criticism of the humanitarian crisis and accusations against Israel. Lt. Gen. Eyal Zamir refuted claims of starvation, blaming Hamas for the suffering and stating military operations will persist regardless of hostage negotiations.

title: ‘Bumrah needs a proper off-season’: Australia cricket great McGrath
content: Glenn McGrath acknowledges Jasprit Bumrah's unique bowling style places extra stress on his body, leading to tough workload management decisions for India. McGrath emphasizes the need for Bumrah to play as much as possible due to his match-winning ability, but also highlights the importance of an off-season to prevent injuries.

title: Delhi Court issues notice to Vadra in money laundering case
content: A Delhi court has issued a notice to Robert Vadra and other accused parties in response to a money laundering complaint filed by the Enforcement Directorate (ED). The Rouse Avenue court has scheduled a hearing for August 28 to address their responses at the pre-cognisance stage, directing the ED to provide copies of the charge sheet to the involved parties.

title: Did a big headload falling from a passenger lead to Delhi station stampede? What govt said
content: A stampede at New Delhi Railway Station on February 15, resulting in 18 fatalities, was triggered by a passenger's dropped headload, according to Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw. The incident occurred on a foot overbridge, causing a chain reaction of falling passengers. Indian Railways has disbursed ₹2 crore in compensation to victims and families.

title: Quinn: McLaurin request business, not distraction
content: Commanders coach Dan Quinn said receiver Terry McLaurin's trade request is not a distraction, calling it a normal part of business in the NFL.

title: Yanks newcomers implode in 13-12 loss to Marlins
content: Newly acquired relievers Jake Bird and David Bednar each gave up home runs as the Yankees couldn't protect the lead in a 13-12 loss to the Marlins.

title: A defensive end? Parsons asks Cowboys for trade
content: Cowboys star defensive end Micah Parsons announces in a social media post that he has requested a trade amid stalled contract extension talks.

title: Track star Richardson arrested in alleged assault
content: Sha'Carri Richardson, the reigning 100-meter world champion, was charged with fourth-degree domestic violence after an alleged incident at the Seattle-Tacoma International Airport.

title: Spurs captain Son to leave club after a decade
content: Tottenham captain Son Heung-min announced in Seoul on Saturday that he will be leaving this summer following a decade with the North London club.

title: 'Quality work': Hunter plays 2 ways in scrimmage
content: Rookie Travis Hunter played 38 snaps -- 17 with the first-team offense and 21 with the first-team defense -- in the Jaguars' scrimmage in front of 11,000 at EverBank Stadium.

title: Source: Messi bodyguard banned by Leagues Cup
content: The Leagues Cup suspended Lionel Messi's bodyguard, Yassine Cheuko, on Friday for improper conduct following an incident after the game against Atlas FC, a source told ESPN.

title: 🏈 Fantasy FB Do Not Draft list: CMC and more
content: The annual hit is back, with players Eric Karabell feels are going earlier than they should in drafts this summer.

title: The Terry McLaurin trade request, explained: Why it could linger, and which teams should be interested
content: The Commanders' star wide receiver wants a new extension -- or a new team.  Can they justify paying him? And what could they get if they dealt him?

title: NBA fact or fiction: Was Draymond right about the end of free agency?
content: Did the CBA ruin NBA free agency? Bobby Marks plays "fact or fiction" with some of the offseason's most impactful trends.

title: Who makes the Year 2 leap? The top 10 sophomores to watch for the 2025-26 season
content: From top 10 picks to Year 1 breakouts, who are the most interesting players to watch in their sophomore season?

title: Expert picks, best bets: How Taira can avoid an upset loss at UFC Fight Night
content: Din Thomas makes his pick for Taira vs. Park and a betting insider finds value bets on this weekend's MMA cards.

title: New Hall of Famer Antonio Gates was a beloved teammate, remains a San Diego legend
content: Gates transformed the tight end position, and he remains remarkable to those who witnessed his exploits.

title: Solak's annual ranking of all 32 NFL coaching staffs: A new No. 1 and No. 32 ahead of the season
content: We used past performance, future expectations, in-game decision-making and more to rank coaching staffs.

title: 'We thought it was dead': How Washington beat the odds -- and its past -- to return to RFK
content: Owner Josh Harris grew up watching Washington in Super Bowls and is thrilled to renew that history with a move back to RFK.

title: Which Man United players need to impress Amorim?
content: A number of Manchester United's squad are facing a crucial season as they look to prove they can be part of the club's future.

title: Arsenal's preseason Asia tour in review
content: Arsenal's preseason tour featured the arrival of a new star striker and the emergence of a bright prospect.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Al Nassr offer Fernandes a Ronaldo reunion
content: Al Nassr are pushing to sign Manchester United midfielder Bruno Fernandes and Cristiano Ronaldo could play a part. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Arsenal still open to Eze deal
content: The summer transfer window is open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could get done?

title: It's time for The Ocho! Check out the 2025 schedule, plus how to watch every event
content: It's time for the 2025 edition of The Ocho! Check out how to watch T-Rex races, paintball, dog surfing and more alternative events on ESPN now.

title: Lapsed fan's guide to 2025 SummerSlam: Two-nighter has something for everyone
content: Our FAQ guide on the latest WWE storylines, including John Cena's final SummerSlam and Jelly Roll's debut.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Where every team stands post-trade deadline
content: There was a lot of action across baseball ahead of Thursday's trade deadline. How did the moves impact each club's standing?

title: The 7 biggest surprises and disappointments of the WNBA season
content: From the Valkyries surpassing expectations to the Aces falling short on theirs, here's what we didn't see coming.

title: What to know ahead of the Hungarian Grand Prix
content: Formula 1 heads to Budapest for round 14 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and predictions for the last race weekend before the summer break.

title: 'Some coaches have no idea': The uncertainties of recruiting in the new rev-share era
content: The uncertainty surrounding how programs will pay players is directly affecting the timeline for high school prospects.

title: Week 10 preview: Key stats, players for Outlaws homecoming
content: The PLL heads to Denver, with two games for the league's top team. Here's the schedule, key stats, injury notes, more.

title: Forecaster for Week 19: Aug 4-10
content: Set your lineups for the week ahead in fantasy baseball with our forecaster, which features pitcher rankings, hitter ratings, schedule observations and more.

title: Risers and fallers: Fiebich trending up, Griner struggling
content: Leonie Fiebich has made the most of her increased opportunity on the Liberty, while Brittney Griner continues to have a down season.

title: South Carolina to Illinois: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 6 quiz
content: From Florida to North Carolina, the "SportsCenter" 50 state tour continues. We're back for our penultimate quiz of the summer.

title: DIG Varun Kumar urges Madras High Court to restrain NTK leader Seeman from making defamatory allegations
content: Justice K. Kumaresh Babu agrees to hear his plea on August 6 and directs the counsel for Seeman to file a counter affidavit by then

title: Meghalaya probing disappearance of coal from depots
content: A High Court-appointed committee said in a recent report that 3,960.95 metric tonnes of coal, declared as extracted and inventoried, had vanished from two designated storage sites

title: First LVM3 launch vehicle equipped with semi-cryogenic stage slated to fly in 2027
content: The three-stage LVM3 had its first experimental flight in December, 2014. The semi-cryogenic stage is designed to make it even more formidable, enhancing payload capability while keeping costs down, says ISRO chief.

title: Darshan murder case: Two arrested for posting vulgar comments about actor Ramya
content: They allegedly posted vulgar comments against Ramya in response to a post she had put up on the developments in the Supreme Court on the murder case in which Darshan is the prime accused

title: It’s painful to see the hills vanish, but change can happen here too, says Madhav Gadgil
content: As climate change accelerates, we are likely to witness an even more unequal distribution of suffering, with the poorest bearing the heaviest burden, renowned environmentalist and recipient of the UNEP’s ‘Champion of the Earth’ award, Professor Madhav Gadgil, said

title: Election Commission has become PM Modi's 'puppet': Mallikarjun Kharge
content: “But today, the Constitution is in danger. Leaders in power are talking about changing the Constitution. If the BJP had won 400 seats in the 2024 elections, they would have changed the Constitution,” says Mallikarjun Kharge

title: Namma Metro facilitates organ transport from Whitefield to Rajarajeshwari Nagar in Bengaluru for transplant
content: A donated human liver, intended for transplant, was transported from Vydehi Hospital at Whitefield to Sparsh Hospital at Rajarajeshwari Nagar using a combination of ambulance and a Namma Metro train

title: Supreme Court sets aside High Court order granting anticipatory bail on condition to resume conjugal life
content: The apex court said that the HC should have considered the prayer for pre-arrest bail entirely on its own merit instead of imposing a condition, which is not traceable to section 438(2) of the erstwhile Code of Criminal Procedure

title: Prajwal Revanna, former Hassan MP, sentenced to life imprisonment for rape of employee in Karnataka
content: A Special Court in Bengaluru pronounced the quantum of sentence after convicting the 34-year-old Prajwal in one of the four sexual abuse and rape cases registered against him, on August 1

title: Dharmasthala burials: Advocate accuses SI of coercing complainant into retracting allegations
content: In a mail addressed to the SIT office and a few SIT officers, advocate Ananya Gowda claimed that her client was allegedly threatened by Sub-Inspector Manjunath Gowda in the SIT camp office at Belthangady

title: Rahul Gandhi will defeat Narendra Modi and defend Constitution: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy
content: Stating that Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi turned down the opportunities to become PM, Telangana CM said that Narendra Modi never stepped away from power since 2001

title: Student Police Cadet is Kerala’s contribution to world, says Minister P. Rajeeve
content: SPC plays a significant role in inculcating among students awareness about law, discipline, social commitment, humanitarian values and sense of justice, he says.

title: Guntur Municipal Corporation cracks down on hotels, restaurants causing traffic disruptions
content: He ordered the seizure of a tiffin stall for converting a road into a parking zone despite repeated warnings

title: Former Chief Justice of India D.Y. Chandrachud vacates official residence
content: Recently, a controversy had arisen over his stay at the official residence of CJI at 5, Krishna Menon Marg, New Delhi, beyond permissible time

title: Two arrested in West Bengal for beating up Muslim men carrying cattle for agricultural work
content: Two persons was arrested by Asansol-Durgapur Police Commissionerate. The assault was led by a BJP youth leader Parijat Ganguly.

title: Ahmedabad Air India crash: U.K. families await update on DNA-matched remains
content: Keystone Law, which has been working with aviation experts to assist many of the families who lost loved ones in the June 12 crash, called for urgency in the process this week

title: APTF asks government to implement Kothari Commission recommendations instead of New Education Policy-2020
content: Bankuru Jogi Naidu said National Education Policy-2020 had many flaws and it was not designed with the consent of all the States and not approved by the Parliament also

title: Court issues notice to Robert Vadra, others in money laundering case
content: Special Judge Sushant Changotra issued the notice to the proposed accused persons after hearing submissions of the Enforcement Directorate (ED)

title: Chandrababu Naidu government focussing on irrigation projects of North Andhra region: Vangalapudi Anitha
content: Along with Minister for MSME Kondapalli Srinivas, she interacted with farmers of Puritipenta village of Gajapathinagaram mandal of the district

title: Officials clear encroachments on 96 acres of forest in Hassan
content: The land, located in survey number 99 of Savanthanahalli in Shantigrama hobli, was being cultivated by 68 persons

title: Delhi govt to table bill to regulate private school fee hikes in Monsoon Session: CM Rekha Gupta
content: For a first offence, schools will face fines ranging from ₹1 lakh to ₹5 lakh, with repeat violations attracting penalties between ₹2 lakh and ₹10 lakh. If the school fails to refund within the specified time, the fine doubles after 20 days, triples after 40 days, and continues to increase with every 20-day delay.

title: Rajnath dares Rahul to detonate 'atom bomb of evidence' against ECI
content: Rahul Gandhi says he is in possession of an atom bomb. If it is so, he should detonate it at once. He should just ensure that he is himself out of harm’s way, says Defence Minister Rajnath Singh

title: T.N. CM Stalin inaugurates medical camps under ‘Nalam Kaakkum Stalin’ scheme
content: Mr. Stalin said as part of the programme, 1,256 camps are being conducted, and priority is given to rural areas, areas where special medical facilities are fewer, and places with higher Scheduled Caste population

title: Kerala Film Policy Conclave begins in Thiruvananthapuram
content: Inaugurating the conclave, CM Pinarayi Vijayan said Kerala can serve a model through a film policy which would aid in the all-round growth and improvement of Malayalam film industry

title: Congress, CPI(M) leaders slam the national award for Kerala Story
content: Culture Minister Saji Cherian termed the award the latest salvo in the socio-economic and cultural war the Sangh Parivar-backed Central Government has unleashed against secular and progressive Kerala

title: Tejashwi Yadav alleges name missing from electoral draft; Patna district administration clarifies his name is registered
content: After RJD leader claimed his name was missing, the Patna District Administration conducted an investigation in this regard and clarified that the name of the RJD leader was registered in the draft voter list

title: Ground realities: climate and crop choices straining Telangana’s water reserves
content: A CSIR–NGRI study warns that over-reliance on groundwater for paddy cultivation, combined with erratic rainfall and hard rock geology, is rapidly depleting the State’s aquifers. Scientists have called for urgent reforms in groundwater management to ensure long-term water and livelihood security

title: Chhattisgarh court grants bail to two Kerala nuns in human trafficking-conversion case
content: The court has granted conditional bail to three persons, including the nuns, says defence lawyer Amrito Das

title: Arya Vysya Sangham urges Andhra Pradesh Government to focus on Vizianagaram’s development
content: Ravva Srinivas said Vizianagaram would get back its glory if Andhra Pradesh Government would create infrastructure for the further growth of trade and business activity

title: Upa Lokayukta visits K. R. Hospital in Mysuru, hears grievances of patients and their attenders
content: After visiting various wards of the hospital, Upa Lokayukta K. N. Phaneendra gathered information from patients about medical treatment and other facilities, including food, water, toilets and cleanliness

title: Karnataka rain: Landslip in Kodagu in region bereft of human habitation
content: On being alerted by residents of Palangala village, officials from the Departments of Mines and Geology, Revenue and Forest reached the spot on August 1 for an on-site inspection

title: 2024 Lok Sabha polls were ‘rigged’ and we will prove it, alleges Rahul Gandhi
content: Citing the findings of an in-house investigations based on ECI data, the Congress leader says 6.5 lakh voters voted in one seat, out of which 1.5 lakh voters were fake

title: Stay home to avoid rape: Gujarat traffic police’s posters spark row; DCP says posters created ‘without their consent’
content: Satarkta Group, an NGO, had created the controversial posters without the consent of the traffic police, the DCP claimed.

title: Rahul Gandhi Claims Arun Jaitley Threatened Him. His Son Replies
content: Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi drew a sharp counter from late BJP leader Arun Jaitley's son this morning, over his claim that the government had sent him to threaten him against pursuing the farm law protests.

title: 2 Arrested For Online Death, Rape Threats To Actor Divya Spandana
content: Ramya filed a complaint against 43 social media accounts for sending her obscene messages, along with rape and death threats.

title: "Made-Up Conversion Story": Tribal Girls After Bail To Kerala Nuns
content: Kumari Lalita Usendi, her voice firm but emotional, says she feels good that she has been proven innocent. "Jyoti Sharma sent bhaiya and sister to jail without any proof. Today we got bail, and it feels good," Ms Usendi said.

title: UK Defends Online Safety Law Amid X's Free Speech Criticisms
content: The UK government on Saturday defended a new online safety law following harsh criticism from social network X.

title: Arunachal's Nocte Queen Dies At 114, Villages Unite for Traditional Rites
content: 114-year-old Phaliam Wangcha, revered as the 'supreme queen' of the eight villages of the Nocte community of Arunachal Pradesh's Tirap district bordering Myanmar, breathed her last at Dadam village in Arunachal Pradesh on July 28.

title: Rajnath Singh Dares Rahul Gandhi To 'Detonate' His 'Vote Theft' Atom Bomb Claim
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Saturday slammed Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for claiming to have an "atom bomb of evidence of vote theft" against the Election Commission, and dared him to detonate the explosive.

title: UP Man Kills Pregnant Wife, Sits Next To Body, Waits For Cops
content: A pregnant woman was stabbed to death by her husband in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut. The husband, Ravi Shankar, killed his seven-month pregnant wife, Sapna, inside a locked room before calling the police on himself.

title: Ex-MP Prajwal Revanna Gets Life Term For Sexually Assaulting House Help
content: Former JD(S) MP Prajwal Revanna has been sentenced to life imprisonment for raping his house help by a special court in Bengaluru.

title: Floating School On Manipur's Loktak Lake Struggles To Stay Afloat
content: Eight years after the northeast region's (NER) first floating elementary school was set up for children of the fishing community of Manipur's Loktak Lake, the school is now battling to survive.

title: WhatsApp Suspends Over 9.8 Million Accounts In India In June, Cites Harmful Activity
content: WhatsApp banned more than 98 lakh accounts in India during June, as part of its efforts to curb abuse and harmful activity on the platform, according to WhatsApp's latest India Monthly Report.

title: Bangladesh To Unveil Reform Charter On Revolution Anniversary
content: Bangladesh's interim government said Saturday it will release its slate of democratic overhauls on August 5, the one-year anniversary of the overthrow of the previous Sheikh Hasina government.

title: Kolkata Police Probe Espionage Angle In Arrest Of Bangladeshi Model Shanta Paul
content: The officials of the Kolkata Police are probing to figure out whether Shanta Paul, the Bangladeshi model arrested from Kolkata earlier this week, was working as a spy in the country just like Haryana-based YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra.

title: "Dropped Laptop, Expected It To Float": Shubhanshu Shukla's Gravity 'Mishap'
content: When Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla returned to Earth after his historic 20-day space mission, he experienced a moment that was both humorous and deeply revealing.

title: Delhi Lt Governor Orders Major Bureaucratic Reshuffle, Transfers 23 IAS Officers
content: Delhi Lt. Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena has issued transfer and posting orders for 23 senior Indian Administrative Service (IAS) and Delhi, Andaman and Nicobar Islands Civil Services (DANICS) officers across various departments.

title: Communal Violence In Pune Over WhatAapp Post: Case Against Over 500
content: Police have registered a total of five FIRs against more than 500 persons in connection with the communal violence in Yavat village of Pune district that broke out over an alleged objectionable post on a social messaging platform.

title: Israel Army Chief Warns Of Combat "Without Rest" In Gaza Unless Hostages Are Freed
content: Israel's top general has warned that there will be no respite in fighting in Gaza if negotiations fail to quickly secure the release of hostages held in the Palestinian territory.

title: UP Woman Plots Husband's Murder, Her Brothers Hire Goons. Then A Twist
content: In a life-saving twist, a man was rescued from a jungle after an alleged murder attempt by his in-laws in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly.

title: "Was Coerced To Take PM Modi's Name": Pragya Thakur On Malegaon Case
content: In an explosive claim, former BJP MP Pragya Thakur has said investigators tried to coerce her into naming PM Narendra Modi, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat and others in connection with the Malegaon blasts case.

title: In Malegaon Verdict, Court Rejects "RDX Theory", Flags A Contradiction
content: The special NIA court, in its verdict on the 2008 Malegaon blast case, held that neither the Maharashtra ATS nor the anti-terror agency was able to establish how RDX was sourced, transported, or assembled for the deadly explosion that killed six.

title: Amarnath Yatra Suspended From Tomorrow, A Week Before It Was To End
content: The annual Amarnath Yatra in Kashmir closed a week before it was to end. Officials cited adverse weather conditions and its impact on the yatra route as the reason for ending the Yatra prematurely.

title: Probe found person with big headload fell on others, led to stampede at New Delhi station: Govt
content: Samajwadi Party MP Ramji Lal Suman asked the Railway Minister about the status of the report of the committee constituted to investigate the stampede and the corrective steps taken by the government.

title: Malegaon blast case: Forced to name Yogi Adityanath, says witness; court scraps his statement to ATS
content: Special Judge A.K. Lahoti said he could not rely on the witness's statement to the ATS, as he submitted to the court that it was given involuntarily

title: Punjab Vigilance Bureau raids Ranjit Singh Gill's residence a day after he joins BJP
content: Mr. Gill had recently resigned from the primary membership of the Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD). He was once considered a close confidant of SAD chief Sukhbir Singh Badal

title: Operation Sindoor succeeded with Mahadev’s blessings, says PM Modi in Varanasi
content: Taking a dig at the Opposition, PM Modi alleged that while the country was celebrating the success of Operation Sindoor, “some people in our own country were troubled by it”

title: Rahul, Congress trying to defame constitutional institutions: Union Minister Meghwal
content: Former Lok Sabha Speaker Balram Jakhar had turned down a demand for a discussion in the House on the Election Commission’s functioning, given that the poll panel is conceived as an independent entity.

title: 'Drug party' case: Action being taken against people speaking against government, says Rohini Khadse
content: Rohini Khadse’s husband Pranjal Khewalkar is among seven persons arrested in a raid at a studio apartment in the upscale Kharadi area of Pune on July 27

title: Minor's sexual assault case: HC upholds charges against suspended Delhi govt official
content: The High Court also upheld the charges of causing miscarriage of the minor girl and disappearance of evidence framed against the official's wife, Seema Rani.

title: No formal discussions held yet: Centre on U.S. F-35 jets query in Lok Sabha
content: Minister of State for External Affairs Kirti Vardhan Singh also said it was conveyed to Vice President J. D. Vance on May 9 that India would appropriately respond if Pakistan launched a major attack

title: Manipur Jiribam killings: Tribal organisations claim arrested persons of Hmar community have no criminal history
content: Two tribal entities allege that the arrests by the National Investigation Agency and the Assam Police were "unjustified"

title: NAPA demands Punjab government to withdraw Land Pooling scheme
content: Satnam Singh Chahal asked Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann not to blindly follow Arvind Kejriwal and his team, who are consistently pushing policies that are detrimental to Punjab's interests

title: All about India-U.S. trade: Infographics
content: In the aftermath of U.S. President Donald Trump’s tariff charges on Indian imports, here is a look at the key numbers defining India-U.S. trade.

title: Madras HC restrains ‘Savukku’ Shankar from defaming ADGP Davidson Devasirvatham in Sivaganga custodial death case
content: Justice K. Kumaresh Babu grants the interim injunction after the ADGP states that the YouTuber peddles lies with a tone of certainty thereby misleading the public at large

title: Landslip in J&K’s Reasi claims lives of SDM, his son; six injured
content: The local administration and medical teams are working to support the affected families and ensure swift recovery for the injured

title: Kargil war veteran turns filmmaker to fight suicide crisis, wins accolades
content: Credited with influencing the Telangana government to launch a 24x7 toll-free suicide prevention helpline, G.J. Rao has produced September-10, an award-winning film that addresses the complex triggers behind self-harm through five deeply personal stories

title: Tight security measures in place ahead of CM Chandrababu Naidu’s visit to Guntur district
content: Further, DSP said Governor Abdul Nazeer will be attending a graduation ceremony at Vignan University. Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu is scheduled to attend a public event in the Mangalagiri rural police station limits

title: You can now pet a puppy at Hyderabad Airport; therapy dogs deployed to ease passenger anxiety
content: The Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in Hyderabad introduces therapy dogs for passenger comfort, offering gentle interactions and moments of calm amid the usual rush of air travel

title: Scientists use AI-designed proteins to generate immune cells
content: The generated cells are expected to enhance immune responses against diseases ranging from cancer to viral infections

title: Eight new Indian Consular Application Centres inaugurated across U.S.
content: India’s Ambassador to the U.S. Vinay Kwatra virtually inaugurated the new Indian Consular Application Centres (ICAC) in Boston, Columbus, Dallas, Detroit, Edison, Orlando, Raleigh and San Jose

title: Goa assembly passes bill to curb touting at tourist spots; fines hiked upto ₹1 lakh
content: State Tourism Minister Rohan Kahunte on August 1 tabled the Goa Tourist Places (Protection and Maintenance) Amendment Bill, 2025

title: A.P. police bust fake websites racket, two arrested in Rajasthan
content: The accused allegedly created fake websites of TTD, Srisailam and Trimbakeshwar temples, APTDC and duped people of ₹50 lakh, says Bapatla SP

title: Jharkhand Education Minister suffers brain injury, to be airlifted to Delhi: Irfan Ansari
content: Mr. Ansari told reporters that Mr. Soren was admitted to the Jamshedpur hospital, where doctors found blood clotting in the brain

title: Terrorist killed in anti-terror operation in J&K’s Kulgam
content: This is the third encounter in J&K this week; six terrorists were left killed in these encounters, including all the three involved in the Pahalgam terror attack

title: Share of AC berths doubled in last decade in long-distance Indian trains
content: Government data also shows that the share of passengers who travelled in AC coaches has tripled in the last decade

title: Bombay HC gets 4th Bench at Kolhapur; sittings from August 18; Maharashtra CM hails move
content: The new Bench is likely to have jurisdiction over six districts — Satara, Sangli, Solapur, Kolhapur, Ratnagiri and Sindhudurg (last two located in coastal Konkan region)

title: BRS conducts preparatory meeting ahead of August 8 public meeting to amplify voices of BCs
content: BRS MLC and Leader of the Opposition in Legislative Council S. Madhusudhan Chary has called upon party functionaries to make the August 8 public meeting a grand success

title: After Prada controversy, LIDCOM and LIDKAR reaffirm ownership of Kolhapuri Chappal GI Tag
content: After a Maharashtra business body engages in discussion with Prada, LIDCOM and LIDKAR say that nobody apart from them can negotiate with Prada or anyone else

title: No resumption of MGNREGA work in West Bengal despite HC order says PBKMS
content: Alleging willful inaction by both the governments, the Paschim Banga Khet Majoor Samity demanded the immediate implementation of MGNREGA work in West Bengal, as per the High Court order. Hearing a petition of the agricultural workers union the Calcutta High Court had directed resumption of MGNREGA in the state from August 1

title: Many MBBS seats remain vacant in country, says Union Minister Anupriya Patel
content: While the government has increased the seats by 39% in the last five years, vacancies persist, underscoring concerns around access, affordability, and distribution of institutions

title: Jagan attempting to incite violence, destabilise State: Atchannaidu
content: The Minister alleged that Mr. Jagan Mohan Reddy was spreading misinformation and backing individuals accused of corruption and indecency

title: CPI(M) calls for protest on August 5 against ‘true-up charges’ burden
content: An additional ₹12,771 crore power tariff burden is sought to be imposed on the consumers, it alleges, and demands its immediate withdrawal

title: NIA makes second consecutive arrest in 2024 Jiribam killings case
content: The accused has been identified as Lalrosang Hmar aka Rosang, of Moinathol village in Assam’s Dilkhosh Grant Cachar

title: This Independence Day, J&K Govt to distribute 15 lakh flags, set up portal for real-time monitoring of events
content: To enhance public involvement, markets and public areas will be decorated, and the distribution of National Flags will be facilitated primarily through Self Help Groups

title: Dharmasthala exhumations day 4: no remains found
content: SIT found partial skeletal remains when they dug up spot 6, the only place they have recovered remains

title: Communal tensions triggers in Pune’s Yavat village, one detained
content: The police deployed SRPF and additional police forces to maintain law and order. During the chaos, the two-wheelers and four-wheelers were vandalised

title: Telangana’s surrogacy scam: The business of selling babies
content: In August 2024, a couple from Rajasthan travelled to Secunderabad for an IVF procedure. A doctor at a clinic they approached convinced them to opt for surrogacy instead. After paying ₹30 lakh and getting a baby a year later, the couple realised through DNA testing that the child was not theirs. Serish Nanisetti and Siddharth Kumar Singh report on the surrogacy scam in Telangana

title: Congress shouldn’t allow BJP to usurp saffron colour, says Prithviraj Chavan amid ‘saffron terror’ charges
content: Chavan says that the govt should appeal against Malegaon order and 7/11 train blasts judgement, so there is justice for the victims

title: Odisha govt. tightens norms for hiring external consultants
content: The capability of in-house employees remains grossly underutilized while dependency on consultants has increased, government says

title: After 7 years, red panda cubs born in Sikkim zoo
content: The captive red panda population at the Himalayan Zoological Park near Gangtok was nearly decimated by two outbreaks of canine distemper, a highly contagious and potentially fatal viral disease

title: 2008 Malegaon case: Congress attempted to fabricate “saffron terror” narrative to humiliate Hindus and for vote-bank politics, says BJP
content: Former ATS officer Mehboob Mujawar has claim that pressure was exerted on him to arrest Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh chief Mohan Bhagwat

title: Afghan man arrested in Jabalpur for ‘illegally’ obtaining Indian passport, running racket; two others held too
content: Apart from having obtained his own passport using fake documents, the accused was also getting Indian passports made for his Afghan friends living in West Bengal and Chhattisgarh

title: Trinamool highlights unnatural death migrant worker in Pune, blames it on targeting of Bengali speakers
content: The deceased worker was identified as Dipu Das (28), a resident of Binnaguri panchayat area of Rajganj of West Bengal’s Jalpaiguri  district. The family members of the migrant worker claimed that he was murdered

title: Five get life term for 2018 Bulandshahr violence
content: Judgment comes more than six years after a police inspector and a local resident died in violence that erupted in a U.P. village over rumours of cow slaughter

title: Kerala, Chhattisgarh units of BJP at odds over nuns’ arrest; will get ‘justice’, insists Rajeev Chandrasekhar
content: Amid protests by the Christian community and political parties in Kerala demanding release of the nuns, the State unit continued its effort to mend bridges with Church leaders.

title: Can OPS succeed where other AIADMK leaders who joined DMK failed?
content: There has been a long-standing trend of AIADMK leaders failing to make a mark in the elections after aligning themselves with the DMK

title: 'Not funny': Sex toy lands on WNBA court again
content: a sex toy was thrown on the court during a game for the second time this week . a whistle was blown to stop play during the third quarter of the Golden State Valkyries' 73-66 victory over the Chicago sky . an official kicked it aside before it was picked up and removed .

title: CFP 2025: 32 teams can make the College Football Playoff
content: the 12-team college football playoff will again include the five highest-ranked conference champions . there are 32 teams -- the most in the CFP era -- with at least a 10% chance of reaching the playoff . the list will shrink by November, but below it starts with 32 teams ranked in order of their percentage chance .
